title: Protocol for use with NEBNext Poly(A) mRNA Magnetic Isolation Module (NEB #E7490) and NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (E7760, E7765)

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description:
To wash the Oligo dT Beads, add the following to a 1.5 ml nuclease-free tube. If preparing multiple libraries, beads for up to 10 samples can be added to a single 1.5 ml tube for subsequent washes (use magnet NEB #S1506 for 1.5 ml tubes). The purpose of this step is to bring the beads from the storage buffer into the binding buffer. The 2X Binding Buffer does not have to be diluted for this step.
AB
1ComponentVolume Per One Library
2Oligo dT Beads d(T)2520 µl
3RNA Binding Buffer100 µl
4Total Volume120 µl

source.description: Wash the beads by pipetting up and down 6 times.

source.description:

RNA Binding Buffer (2X) per sample. The Binding Buffer does not have to be diluted.

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description: Spin down the tube briefly to collect the liquid from the wall and lid of the tube.

source.body: It is important to spin down the tube to prevent carryover of the Wash Buffer in subsequent steps.

source.title: Probe Hybridization to RNA

source.description: Mix thoroughly by pipetting up and down 10 times.

source.body: Keep the mix on ice until mRNA is purified. It will be used in Step 38 and 41.

source.title: Probe Hybridization to RNA

source.description:
Prepare the First Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer and Random Primer Mix (2X) in a nuclease-free microcentrifuge tube as follows:
AB
1ComponentVolume
2NEBNext First Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer8 µl
3NEBNext Random Primers2 µl
4Nuclease-free Water10 µl
5Total Volume20 µl
You can prepare the first strand synthesis reaction buffer later in the protocol, but it is important that it is ready before the elution in step 38. The beads should not be allowed to dry out.

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description:
Add
RNA Binding Buffer (2X) to the beads and mix by pipetting up and down until beads are homogenous. If preparing multiple libraries, add
RNA Binding Buffer (2X) per sample. This first binding step removes most of the non target RNA.

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description:
Mix thoroughly by pipetting up and down 6 times. Place the tube on the bench and incubate at room temperature for
to allow the mRNA to bind to the beads.

source.description:
Place the tube on the thermocycler. Close the lid and heat the samples at
for
, then cool to
with the heated lid set at ≥
to do the first elution of the mRNA from the beads.

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description:
Place the tube on the magnet at room temperature until the solution is clear (~

source.title: mRNA Isolation, Fragmentation and Priming Starting with Total RNA

source.description: Remove and discard all of the supernatant from the tube. Take care not to disturb the beads that contains the mRNA.

source.body: It is important to remove all of the supernatant to successfully fragment the mRNA in the subsequent steps. Spin down the tube. Place the tube on the magnetic rack and with a 10 μl tip, remove all of the wash buffer. (Caution: Do not disturb beads that contain the mRNA). Avoid letting the beads dry out before adding elution buffer.

source.title: First Strand cDNA Synthesis

source.description:
Assemble the first strand synthesis reaction on ice by adding the following components to the fragmented and primed RNA from Step 42:
AB
1First Strand Synthesis ReactionVolume
2Fragmented and Primed RNA (Step 36)10 µl
3NEBNext Strand Specificity Reagent8 µl
4NEBNext First Strand Synthesis Enzyme Mix2 µl
5Total Volume20 µl

source.name: NEBNext First Strand Synthesis Enzyme Mix

source.description: Mix thoroughly by pipetting up and down 10 times.

from 15 minutes to 50 minutes at Step 2 below.

source.title: Second Strand cDNA Synthesis

source.description:
Assemble the second strand cDNA synthesis reaction on ice by adding the following components into the first strand synthesis product from Step 46).
AB
1Second Strand Synthesis ReactionVolume
2First Strand Synthesis Product (Step 46)20 µl
3NEBNext Second Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer with dUTP (10X)8 µl
4NEBNext Second Strand Synthesis Enzyme Mix4 µl
5Nuclease-free Water48 µl
6Total Volume80 µl

Add
(1.8X) of resuspended beads to the second strand synthesis reaction (~

source.description:
Incubate for
at room temperature.

source.title: Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Briefly spin the tube in a microcentrifuge to collect any sample on the sides of the tube. Place the tube on a magnet to separate beads from the supernatant. After the solution is clear, carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads, which contain DNA.
Caution: Do not discard beads.

source.title: Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Add
of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic rack. Incubate at room temperature for
, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

source.title: Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description: Repeat Step 54 once for a total of 2 washing steps.

source.title: Repeat Step
Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic rack with lid open.
Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

source.title: Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Remove the tube from the magnetic rack. Elute the DNA from the beads by adding
0.1X TE Buffer (provided) to the beads. Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Quickly spin the tube and incubate for
at room temperature. Place the tube on the magnetic rack until the solution is clear.

source.title: Purification of Double-stranded cDNA Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Remove
of the supernatant and transfer to a clean nuclease-free PCR tube.

source.body: If you need to stop at this point in the protocol samples can be stored at –20°C.

source.title: End Prep of cDNA Library

source.description:
Assemble the end prep reaction on ice by adding the following components to the second strand synthesis product from Step 58.
AB
1End Prep ReactionVolume
2Second Strand Synthesis Product (Step 58)50 µl
3NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer7 µl
4NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix3 µl
5Total Volume60 µl
If a master mix is made, add
of master mix to
of cDNA for the End Prep reaction.

source.name: NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix

source.title: End Prep of cDNA Library

source.description: Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 50 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

source.body: It is important to mix well. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.

source.title: End Prep of cDNA Library

source.description:
Incubate the sample in a thermocycler with the heated lid set at ≥
as follows.
at

source.title: End Prep of cDNA Library

source.description: Proceed immediately to Adaptor Ligation.

source.title: Adaptor Ligation

source.description:
[ ! ] Dilute the NEBNext Adaptor* prior to setting up the ligation reaction in ice-cold Adaptor Dilution Buffer and keep the adaptor on ice.
AB
1Total RNA InputDilution Required
21,000 ng–250 ng5–fold dilution in Adaptor Dilution Buffer
3249 ng–100 ng25–fold dilution in Adaptor Dilution Buffer
499 ng–10 ng100–fold dilution in Adaptor Dilution Buffer
*The NEBNext adaptor is provided in NEBNext oligos kit. NEB has several oligo kit options, which are supplied separately from the library prep kit.

source.title: Adaptor Ligation

source.description:
Assemble the ligation reaction on ice by adding the following components, in the order given, to the end prep reaction product from Step 62.
AB
1Ligation ReactionVolume
2End Prepped DNA (Step 62)60 µl
3Diluted Adaptor (Step 63)2.5 µl
4NEBNext Ligation Enhancer1 µl
5NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix30 µl
6Total Volume93.5 µl

source.body: The Ligation Master Mix and Ligation Enhancer can be mixed ahead of time and is stable for at least 8 hours @ . We do not recommend premixing the Ligation Master Mix, Ligation Enhancer and adaptor prior to use in the Adaptor Ligation Step.

source.name: NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix

source.title: Adaptor Ligation

source.description:
Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 80 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.
[ ! ] Caution: The NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix is very viscous. Care should be taken to ensure adequate mixing of the ligation reaction, as incomplete mixing will result in reduced ligation efficiency. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.

source.title: Adaptor Ligation

source.description: Incubate 15 minutes at 20°C in a thermocycler.

source.title: Incubate
Adaptor Ligation

source.description:
Add
(blue) USER™ Enzyme to the ligation mixture from Step 60, resulting in total volume of

source.description:
Mix well and incubate at
for
with the heated lid set to ≥
.

source.title: Adaptor Ligation

source.description: Proceed immediately to Purification of the Ligation Reaction.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
[ ! ] Note: If you are selecting for libraries with larger insert size (> 200 nt) follow the size selection recommendations in Appendix A, Chapter 6.
Add
(0.9X) resuspended SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads and mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down at least 10 times.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Incubate for
at room temperature.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Quickly spin the tube in a microcentrifuge and place the tube on an appropriate magnetic rack to separate beads from the supernatant. After the solution is clear (~
), discard the supernatant that contains unwanted fragments.
Caution: Do not discard beads.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Add
of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic rack. Incubate at room temperature for
, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description: Repeat Step 73 once for a total of 2 washing steps.

source.title: Repeat Step
Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description: Briefly spin the tube, and put the tube back in the magnetic rack.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Completely remove the residual ethanol, and air dry beads until the beads are dry for up to 5 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic rack with the lid open.
[ ! ] Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Remove the tube from the magnetic rack. Elute DNA target from the beads by adding
0.1X TE (provided) to the beads. Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down. Quickly spin the tube and incubate for
at room temperature. Put the tube in the magnet until the solution is clear.

source.title: Purification of the Ligation Reaction Using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads

source.description:
Without disturbing the bead pellet, transfer
of the supernatant to a clean PCR tube and proceed to PCR enrichment.

source.body: If you need to stop at this point in the protocol samples can be stored at –20°C.

source.title: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor Ligated DNA

source.description:
[ ! ] Check and verify that the concentration of your oligos is 10 μM on the label.
[ ! ] Use Option A for any NEBNext oligos kit where index primers are supplied in tubes. These kits have the forward and reverse primers supplied in separate tubes.
Use Option B for any NEBNext oligos kit where index primers are supplied in a 96-well plate format. These kits have the forward and reverse (i7 and i5) primers combined.

source.title: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor Ligated DNA

source.description:
Set up the PCR reaction as described below based on the type of oligos (PCR primers) used.
Option A: Forward and Reverse Primers Separate:
AB
1ComponentVolume Per One Library
2Adaptor Ligated DNA (Step 78)15 µl
3NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix25 µl
4Universal PCR Primer/i5 Primer*,**5 µl
5Index (X) Primer/i7 Primer*,**5 µl
6Total Volume50 µl
Option B: Forward and Reverse Primers Combined:
AB
1ComponentVolume Per One Library
2Adaptor ligated DNA (Step 78)15 µl
3NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix25 µl
4Index (X)/Universal Primer Mix*10 µl
5Total Volume50 µl
* NEBNext Oligos must be purchased separately from the library prep kit. Refer to the corresponding NEBNext Oligo kit manual for determining valid barcode combinations.
** Use only one i7 primer/ index primer per sample. Use only one i5 primer (or the universal primer for single index kits) per sample

source.title: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor Ligated DNA

source.description: Mix well by gently pipetting up and down 10 times. Quickly spin the tube in a microcentrifuge.

source.title: PCR Enrichment of Adaptor Ligated DNA

source.description:
Place the tube on a thermocycler with the heated lid set to
and perform PCR amplification using the following PCR cycling conditions (refer to Table 82.A and Table 82.B):
Table 82.A:
ABCD
1Cycle StepTempTimeCycles
2Initial Denaturation98°C30 seconds1
3Denaturation98°C10 seconds8–16*,**
4Annealing/Extension65°C15 seconds
5Extension72°C20 seconds
6Final Extension72°C5 minutes1
7Hold4°C∞ 
* The number of PCR cycles should be adjusted based on RNA input.
** It is important to limit the number of PCR cycles to avoid overamplification. If overamplification occurs, a second peak ~ 1,000 bp will appear on the Bioanalyzer trace (See Figure 7.2 in Manual).
Table 82.B: Recommended PCR cycles based on total RNA input amount:
AB
1Total RNA InputRecommended PCR Cycles
21,000 ng8–9
3100 ng12–13
410 ng15–16
Note: PCR cycles are recommended based on high quality Universal Human Reference Total RNA. It may require
optimization based on the sample quality to prevent PCR over-amplification.

Remove the tube from the magnetic rack. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding

of the supernatant to a clean PCR tube, and store at –20°C.

source.title: Assess Library Quality on an Agilent Bioanalyzer DNA Chip

source.description:
Run
library on a DNA 1000 chip. If the library yield is too low to quantify on this chip, please run the samples on a DNA High Sensitivity chip. A dilution may be necessary for running on a Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA Chip.

source.title: Assess Library Quality on an Agilent Bioanalyzer DNA Chip

source.description: Check that the electropherogram shows a narrow distribution with a peak size approximately 300 bp.

source.body: Note: If a peak at ~ 80 bp (primers) or 128 bp (adaptor-dimer) is visible in the bioanalyzer traces, bring up the sample volume (from Step 85) to 50 μl with 0.1X TE buffer and repeat the SPRIselect Bead or NEBNext Sample Purification Bead Cleanup Step (Section "Purification of the PCR Reaction using SPRIselect Beads or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads").

source.title: Assess Library Quality on an Agilent Bioanalyzer DNA Chip

source.description: Figure 94: Example of RNA library size distribution on a Bioanalyzer.

source.body: [ ! ] The next step provides a fragmentation incubation time resulting in an RNA insert size of ~ 200 nt. For RNA insert sizes > 200 nt, refer to Chapter 6 (Appendix A) for recommended fragmentation times in Step 39.

source.description:
Collect the fragmented mRNA by transferring
of the supernatant to a nuclease-free 0.2 ml PCR tube.

source.body: If the supernatant volume recovered is less than 10 μl for any reason, bring the volume up to 10 μl by adding the First Strand Synthesis Reaction Buffer and Random Primer Mix (2X) prepared in Step 2 and continue with the protocol.
Avoid transferring any of the magnetic beads.

materials.name: DNase I (e.g., NEB #M0303) and DNase I Cleanup Reagants or Kit for Removal of DNA Prior to Depletion

description: The NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina contains the enzymes and buffers required to convert a broad range of input amounts of RNA into high quality directional (strand-specific) libraries for next-generation sequencing on the Illumina platform. The fast, user-friendly workflow has minimal hands-on time and is compatible with poly(A) mRNA enrichment and rRNA depletion methods.
